summary: The Community Mental Wellness and Resilience Act of 2025 aims to promote mental wellness and resilience within communities. It authorizes grant programs to establish, operate, or expand community-based mental wellness programs. These programs will utilize a public health approach, focusing on prevention and promotion, identifying protective and risk factors, building community awareness, and implementing strategic plans. The bill defines key terms such as 'public health approach,' 'community trauma,' and 'resilience.' Funding of $36 million is authorized for fiscal years 2026-2030, with a rural set-aside. Technical assistance is also provided.
